image.altText: A close up of Lia Finocchiaro sitting in her parliamentary office.

props.synopsis: From youth justice and spithoods, to climate targets and whether her party is fit to govern again, Northern Territory Opposition Leader Lia Finocchiaro lays out her vision should she win this year's election.

title.children: NT opposition says 'everyday Territorians' are the experts on youth crime in election pitch

image.altText: Two people cause damage to the inside of a building, seen through a still image from black and white CCTV vision.

props.synopsis: As violent youth offences continue to rise in the NT, legal experts have criticised the Lawler government for holding another review into the issue.

title.children: Violent youth crime spikes by 50 per cent in the Northern Territory in four years

image.altText: A man pulls up a pallet outside shop.

props.synopsis: The national corporate regulator has temporarily banned a homewares retail chain, which has stores across regional and remote Australia, from signing up customers to credit agreements using the financial tool Centrepay.

title.children: Regulator bans retail chain using payment tool after concerns of financial harm to First Nations consumers

image.altText: A woman wearing a headband and blue dress looks at the camera and is surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Growing up, June Oscar heard racial slurs in the playground. Decades later, she says it's disturbing that such language continues to be used.Â

title.children: Lawyer says racism in the police force is not just 'a few bad apples'

image.altText: A still frame of a video uses graphics to highlight two specific weapons

props.synopsis: A month before a massacre in Papua New Guinea's highlands, videos emerged of the high-powered weapons tribes in the region now have in their possession.Â

title.children: The videos that should have raised an alarm in PNG that blood was about to be shed

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: House prices rose in all capital cities except Hobart in February as demand outstrips supply and buyers hope for an interest rate cut later this year.

title.children: House prices continue to rise despite higher interest rates, inflation and cost of living

image.altText: A wounded Palestinian man lies on a cart as Palestinians gather to wait for trucks carrying bags of flour to arrive.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Gaza claim Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near Gaza City, reportedly killing more than 100 Palestinians and wounded hundreds more.

title.children: Gaza authorities say Israeli troops opened fire near aid trucks, IDF says trampling happened

image.altText: A composite image of Robert and Malcolm Cole

props.synopsis: Malcolm Cole was Indigenous and gay. He later died from HIV but in 1988 he created a "stirring" moment at Sydney's Mardi Gras and now his twin brother is determined to make sure his legacy lives on.

title.children: Captain Cook is marching at Mardi Gras and it's not the first time

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of Australian coronavirus victim James Kwan smiling outdoors and waving a hand in the air.

props.synopsis: When James Kwan became the first Australian casualty from the virus in 2020, it was only weeks later his beloved tourism industry was brought to its knees.

title.children: Four years after a tourism stalwart's death from COVID-19, how is his beloved industry recovering?

title.children: NT Police refutes Rolfe's evidence of racism in force at Walker inquest

image.altText: Children at Bubup Wilam child care centre colour in.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has promised to gradually phase out middle schools in response to a sweeping review of the territory's secondary school system.Â

title.children: NT government to scrap middle schools after education review

image.altText: Ley is looking at Dutton as they walk through a corridor. Dutton is smiling.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton and his deputy Sussan Ley are chastised after the Liberal Party jumped on the arrest of a former immigration detainee that later was revealed to have been wrongly made.Â

title.children: Liberals chastised for 'lynch mob' after revelations ex-immigration detainee was wrongly arrested

image.altText: Dozens of high school boys students, in uniform, in a grandstand, cheering on their rugby team.

props.synopsis: With several single-sex schools announcing they'll go co-ed in coming years, the debate about whether gendered schooling is better for your children has again reared its head. We ask education experts, advocates and a neurologist to break down the evidence.

title.children: With the single-sex vs co-ed debate back in the news, we asked experts what type of school is better

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a business jacket poses for a photo inside a modern building.

props.synopsis: There are calls for a specialised crimes unit following revelations in a Four Corners and Guardian Australia investigation.

title.children: Australia urged to do more to investigate alleged genocide perpetrators in the country

image.altText: Cameron Green raises his bat next to Josh Hazlewood

image.altText: lipstick

props.synopsis: There are renewed warnings of dark clouds hanging over the Australian economy. And the former boss of an upmarket department store says those warnings have been reinforced by the increase in sales of lipstick.

title.children: The ominous reason lipstick sales are up, according to one former department store boss

image.altText: Taylor Swift sings into a microphone on stage in Sydney while dressed in a sequin bodysuit.

title.children: Why Taylor Swift's exclusive Singapore show is stirring up political controversy

image.altText: Narissa takes a selfie in the car with her dog

props.synopsis: Women experiencing pelvic pain related to conditions like endometriosis say their concerns are often dismissed. We asked the experts for their advice on being heard.

title.children: 'She's been my absolute saviour': How Narissa found a doctor who took her pelvic pain seriously

image.altText: Dark storm clouds swallow blue sunlit skies

image.altText: An illustration of a male prisoner sitting in a Russian cell.

title.children: What life is like inside Russia's brutal prison system

image.altText: Woman stands with arms crossed in small room

props.synopsis: Mansi Matoo's room at Curtin University has no air-conditioning and is so small, she has to store her clothes in a suitcase under the bed. But her weekly rent has just risen from $145 to $235.

title.children: Rents have gone up $90 a week for rooms on this university campus, and students are reeling

image.altText: A woman in a tight black one piece outfit with her hands on her shoulders

props.synopsis: What started as a poem written in a chemistry class has become one of the world's most revered LGBT anthems. CeCe Peniston reflects on how she built a career on Finally.Â

title.children: How CeCe Peniston wrote one of the biggest LGBT anthems of all time

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Productivity tumbled in 2022-23 after a pandemic sugar hit, in part because of a surge in hours worked.

image.altText: Anne Berthelsen using menopause medication

title.children: Women 'tearing their hair out' amid continuing global shortage of vital menopause medication

image.altText: Two bearded men with their arms around each other smile at the camera with the BBC logo on a sign behind them

image.altText: Alcor Life Extension Foundation cryogenic chambers.Â

title.children: The strange last request of one of China's great intellectuals

image.altText: A blue EV model from Chinese brand BYD.

title.children: 'Risks to our national security': White House to investigate national security data risks from Chinese vehicles

image.altText: A group of people sit or stand in a barbecue shelter.

title.children: 'They're not rich people': Caravan park residents told their homes may be 'non-compliant', and they'll have to go

image.altText: A bald police officer speaks at a podium.

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens
